com.peterson.markovchain

Class BasicMarkovChain

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.peterson.markovchain.BasicMarkovChain
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MarkovChain
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ConcurrentBasicMarkovChain

    public class BasicMarkovChain
extends java.lang.Object
implements MarkovChain
    Markov Chain Creation Class. These are simple Markov Chains which are formed via parsing strings as input and picking random phrases based on a start word. This Markov generator is simple; it only parses strings based on spaces and ends all phrases with a period; but fun to use, especially when fed a lot of input material. Note: due to the nature of text and parsing, an occasional exception may be thrown.
    Author:
    Peterson, Ryan Created: 3/14/2015

      • setRegexPattern

        public void setRegexPattern(java.util.regex.Pattern pattern)

      • addPhrase

        public void addPhrase(java.lang.String phrase)
        Description copied from interface: MarkovChain
        Add a single phrase to the database. This will generate with previous chains with the chain resulting from the passed phrase. The words of the phrase generate with the assumption that each word is separated by a space, and if the sentence does not contain a period at the end, it will be appended with one.
        Specified by:
        addPhrase in interface MarkovChain
        Parameters:
        phrase - the sentence to add to the chain.

      • generateSentence

        public java.lang.String generateSentence()
        Description copied from interface: MarkovChain
        Generate a random sentence using the chains in the database. This is the default behaviour of a markov chain; it starts off with the first element in the chain and forms based off of that. Calls to this method remove no data from the chain database.
        Specified by:
        generateSentence in interface MarkovChain
        Returns:
        a single generated sentence.

      • generateSentence

        public java.lang.String generateSentence(java.lang.String seed)
        Description copied from interface: MarkovChain
        Generates a Markov phrase based off a seed word. Similar to generateSentence(), this will generate a phrase using the supplied seed word as a start state. If, for some reason, the word is not in the database, this will return NO_CHAIN, signaling that a chain could not be formed
        Specified by:
        generateSentence in interface MarkovChain
        Parameters:
        seed - the seed word to start the chain with
        Returns:
        a generated phrase using the seed word or NO_CHAIN if a chain could not be started

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Present a human readable string representing the chains in the database. This is presented as "KEY [key_value]->{value list} Due to the nature of how things are represented, this is essentially a wall of text.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a string representing the state of the object
